tentpoles_detailed.description: Detailed breakdown of tentpole chapters across the trilogy with structural requirements and emotional beats

chapter_1.title: The Beneath
structural_requirements: Establish Mars setting with rich sensory detail
Introduce Kessa's character, expertise, and personal stakes
Discovery of alien megastructure beneath Olympus Mons
Sense of wonder mixed with wrongness
Plant foreshadowing elements
emotional_beats: Kessa's scientific excitement at discovery
Awe at scale and alienness of structure
Unease at implications
Isolation and dedication to work
world_elements_to_establish: Year 6 of terraforming approaching critical year 7
Mars landscape in transition - red dust and new atmosphere
Corporate colony structure and scientific hierarchy
Excavation technology and archaeological methods

chapter_7.title: Buried Evidence
structural_requirements: Introduce Dmitri Volkov as antagonist
Corporate suppression of findings begins
Terraforming accelerates despite warnings
First signs of structure activity (minor seismic events)
Establish central conflict between knowledge and profit
emotional_beats: Kessa's frustration at being silenced
Dmitri's calculated pragmatism and hidden desperation
Growing tension between scientific community and corporate interests
First hints of danger being real, not theoretical
world_elements_to_establish: Corporate decision-making processes
Dmitri's daughter in refugee fleet (personal stakes)
Timeline pressure of seven-year threshold
Political divisions in colony

chapter_12.title: Immune Response
structural_requirements: Structure responds to terraforming with defensive measures
Shift from discovery story to survival horror
Kessa realizes structure is still active and protecting Mars
Seismic events, atmospheric corrections escalate
Point of no return - can't just stop excavation now
emotional_beats: Terror as academic interest becomes existential threat
Kessa's horror at inadvertently triggering response
Dawning understanding that structure sees humans as disease
Desperate attempts to communicate intentions
world_elements_to_establish: The Gardener's response patterns
Scope of structure's capabilities
Vulnerability of colonies to atmospheric changes
First casualties (equipment, not people yet)

chapter_17.title: Olympus Falling
structural_requirements: First colony destroyed by structure's immune response
Hundreds dead, including named characters
Kessa's warnings validated too late
Catastrophic consequences made visceral and personal
Survivors must process guilt and grief
emotional_beats: Horror and chaos of colony destruction
Kessa's guilt at not stopping it despite warnings
Dmitri's breakdown as his solutions fail
Moral weight of decisions that led here
Shift from prevention to damage control
world_elements_to_establish: Scale of The Gardener's defensive capability
Fragility of human colonies on hostile world
Irreversible nature of some choices
Refugee fleet still in orbit watching disaster

chapter_20.title: Fracture Lines
structural_requirements: Mars colonies divide into factions
Some want to halt terraforming, others accelerate
Earth refugee fleet demands landing rights
Political and social consequences of disaster
Setup for Book 2 conflicts
emotional_beats: Grief and exhaustion after trauma
Impossible choices with no good options
Kessa's determination to understand The Gardener
Sage emerges as voice of Mars-first position
Zhang Wei's desperation as refugee supplies dwindle
world_elements_to_establish: Three-way split: continue terraforming, stop terraforming, adapt to Mars
Timeline: year 7 threshold approaching in months
Mars independence movement gaining support
Earth's declining ability to influence Mars

generation_notes.pacing: Each tentpole must advance plot significantly while deepening character arcs
generation_notes.atmosphere: Maintain creeping dread beneath colonial optimism throughout
generation_notes.sensory_detail: Rich descriptions of Mars landscape, dust, thin atmosphere, alien architecture
generation_notes.scientific_accuracy: Hard sci-fi realism except for The Gardener as one speculative element
generation_notes.foreshadowing: Plant elements in each chapter that pay off later in trilogy
generation_notes.character_consistency: Check voice markers and knowledge states before writing
